content: The following lists events that happened during **1971 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng) (Acting) (23 November 1970 to 2 January), [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Sheares) (starting 2 January) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 1 January – The [Monetary Authority of Singapore](/wiki/Monetary_Authority_of_Singapore) was established to regulate the financial sector and as Singapore's central bank. - 2 January – Dr [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) becomes the second [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore). - 3 January – [Jurong Bird Park](/wiki/Jurong_Bird_Park) opens to the public. - 14–22 January - Singapore hosts the 18th Conference of the [Commonwealth](/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations) Heads of Government Meeting. - 29 January – The [Preservation of Monuments Board](/wiki/National_Heritage_Board_(Singapore)) was established to identify and safeguard buildings of great historical value and recommend as national monuments. ### February - 1 February – The National Sports Promotion Board is formed to promote and develop sports in Singapore. ### March - 15 March – The Staff Training Institute (now the [Civil Service College](/wiki/Civil_Service_College_Singapore)) is established to train civil servants. ### April - 15–16 April – Singapore, [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), [Australia](/wiki/Australia), and [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand) sign the [Five Power Defence Arrangements](/wiki/Five_Power_Defence_Arrangements). The agreement comes into effect on 1 November the same year. - 23 April – - The [Shangri-La Hotel Singapore](/wiki/Shangri-La_Hotel_Singapore) is opened. - The first Concept Plan is unveiled, which proposes a 'Ring Plan'. ### May - 11 May – Local newspapers *[Eastern Sun](/wiki/Eastern_Sun)* and the *[Singapore Herald](/wiki/Singapore_Herald)* were accused by then-[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) of having been involved in "black operations". They later shut down on 18 May and 28 May respectively. ### July - 14 July – The Jurong Drive-in Cinema is opened as Singapore's first and only open-air drive-in cinema. The cinema operated for 15 years until its closure on 30 September 1985. - 30 July – Singapore's first [sex reassignment surgery](/wiki/Sex_reassignment_surgery) is performed on a 24-year-old who becomes a woman after the surgery, led by Dr S. S. Ratnam. The surgery is declared a success. ### October - 23 October – The [Sentosa Satellite Earth Station](/wiki/Sentosa_Satellite_Earth_Station) is officially launched, making it Singapore's first Satellite Earth Station. - 31 October – The last British military forces withdraws from Singapore. ### November - 2 November – The [Central Narcotics Bureau](/wiki/Central_Narcotics_Bureau) is set up to tackle the problem of drugs in Singapore. - 7 November – The first Tree Planting Day is launched by Dr [Goh Keng Swee](/wiki/Goh_Keng_Swee) in [Mount Faber](/wiki/Mount_Faber). ### December - 1 December – The [Singapore Traction Company](/wiki/Singapore_Traction_Company) ceases operations. - 2 December – The Clean Air Act is passed to deal with pollution caused by early industrialisation. - 29 December – The [Gold Bars triple murders](/wiki/Gold_Bars_Triple_Murders) saw a gold merchant and his two employees robbed and killed by a group of 10 men. Seven of the 10 men were sentenced to death for the crime; the remaining three were indefinitely detained for lengthy periods before their release. ### Date unknown - Tower 1 of [Mandarin Orchard Singapore](/wiki/Mandarin_Orchard_Singapore) is opened. ## Births - 27 January – [Fann Wong](/wiki/Fann_Wong), actress. - 30 January – [Bryan Wong](/wiki/Bryan_Wong), actor. - 23 July – [Christopher Lee](/wiki/Christopher_Lee_(Malaysian_actor)), Malaysia-born Singaporean actor. - 29 July – [Selena Tan](/wiki/Selena_Tan), producer, director, writer and actress. - 13 October – [Chia Shi-Lu](/wiki/Chia_Shi-Lu), medical practitioner and former politician. - 1 December – [Patrick Tay](/wiki/Patrick_Tay), politician and lawyer. - [Daren Shiau](/wiki/Daren_Shiau), writer, lawyer, and environmental activist. ## Deaths - 7 February – Chen Yoh Shoo, former chairman of the [Singapore Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry](/wiki/Singapore_Chinese_Chamber_of_Commerce_and_Industry) (b. 1900). - 25 June – Goh Chew Chua, former Parliamentary Secretary to the [Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) and former legislative assemblyman for [Tampines Constituency](/wiki/Tampines_Constituency) (b. 1897). - 22 August – [Aw Cheng Chye](/wiki/Aw_Cheng_Chye), millionaire, businessman, company director and philanthropist (b. 1924). - 21 September – Tan Chor Lam, businessman and 1st chairman of the [Nanyang](/wiki/Nanyang_(region)) Branch of the [Tongmenghui](/wiki/Tongmenghui) (b. 1884). title: 1971 in Singapore
